description: The course focuses on the creation, funding, and management of biotechnology and health services enterprises. The course is designed to supplement other offerings in the Health Care Systems and Management Departments for those students with entrepreneurial interest in such ventures, and will focus on special issues surrounding the conceptualization, planning, diligence and capitalization, launch, compensation and management of these ventures. In addition, course offers methods for self-assessment & development of business models and plans, techniques for technology assessment and strategy, develops foundation for capitalization and partnering strategies, and creates a basis for best practices in company launch and plan execution. Students must apply to take this course. Please see the Health Care Management Department for the application.
name: HC ENTREPRENEURSHIP

values.comments:
The course focuses on the creation, funding, and management of biotechnology and health services enterprises. The course is designed to supplement other offerings in the Health Care Systems and Management Departments for those students with entrepreneurial interest in such ventures, and will focus on special issues surrounding the conceptualization, planning, diligence and capitalization, launch, compensation and management of these ventures. In addition, course offers methods for self-assessment & development of business models and plans, techniques for technology assessment and strategy, develops foundation for capitalization and partnering strategies, and creates a basis for best practices in company launch and plan execution. 

Student were enjoyed the class as they said it was a “fantastic” and “great” course. They found the material very “practical” and “useful.”

Students did not comment on Professor Libson but they did, however, say that the guest speakers were “great” and “shed light on starting your own company.” 

Students did not comment on the grading except for one student who said that students could “coast through the course and likely get a good grade.” This is an upper level course that students must apply to take. Please see the Health Care Management Department for the application.

Health Care Management 867 focuses on the creation, funding, and management of biotechnology and health services enterprises. The course is designed to supplement other offerings in the Health Care Systems and Management Departments for those students with entrepreneurial interest in such ventures, and will focus on special issues surrounding the conceptualization, planning, diligence and capitalization, launch, compensation and management of these ventures. In addition, course offers methods for self-assessment & development of business models and plans, techniques for technology assessment and strategy, develops foundation for capitalization and partnering strategies, and creates a basis for best practices in company launch and plan execution. 

Overall, this course was described as “useful” and rewarding. Students said that the course relied heavily upon guest speakers and provided students with “great perspectives” on how to manage a healthcare start-up. Many students found it helpful that this course covered “lots of practical applications.” Some students hoped that there could be more professor-taught lectures as well as feedback from and interaction with the teaching staff.

Students said Professor Kurtzman was “very approachable” and willing to help the students.

Undergraduate students need permission to attend this course, and other students must apply to take this course. Please see the Health Care Management Department for the application.
